newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Stockpile sells cobalt for avg $19.47/lb.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Stockpile sells cobalt for avg $19.47/lb.

text.p: The U.S. Defense Logistics Agency said Wednesday it sold a total of 200,806 pounds of cobalt contained for an average $19.47 per pound.
Glencore Ltd of Stamford, Conn., was the sole successful recipient, the DLA said.

The agency received bids Monday for a total of 999,537 pounds of cobalt contained. But several bidders failed to comply with the terms and conditions of the invitation for bids and were ineligible for awards, the DLA said.
Glencore bought 49,229 pounds contained of 99.30-99.39 percent cobalt located in New Haven, Indiana, for $20.01 per pound.
It bought a further 43,680 pounds contained of 99.30-99.39 percent cobalt located in Somerville, NJ, also for $20.01 per pound.
And it bought 53,405 pounds contained in Scotia, New York, and 54,492 pounds contained in Curtis Bay, Md., both quantities 99.00-99.29 percent cobalt at $19.01 per pound.
The agency said the next sealed-bid spot cobalt sale is scheduled for March, 1997.
A negotiated, long-term sale is scheduled for February, 1997, the DLA said.
